wikipedia_page.main: Sarah Cleaveland  is a veterinary surgeon and Professor of Comparative Epidemiology at the University of Glasgow.

response: * 2018 Sarah Cleaveland, Can we make rabies history? Realising the value of research for the global elimination of rabies

Despite the university's delay in admitting women to full degrees, Cambridge women were at the heart of scientific research throughout the 20th century. Notable female scientists include; biochemist Marjory Stephenson, plant physiologist Gabrielle Howard, social anthropologist Audrey Richards, psycho-analyst Alix Strachey, who with her husband translated the works of Sigmund Freud, Kavli Prize-winner Brenda Milner, co-discovery of specialised brain networks for memory and cognition. Veterinary epidemiologist Sarah Cleaveland has worked to eliminate rabies in the Serengeti.
